Author: plans-are-overrated
Text: Oh my gosh I can completely relate!! I feel like I have no incentive no motive and I feel so foolish for being so obsessed with my ED and not giving him enough attention. Now I just feel so empty and nothing seems to matter. Stay strong though, we can get through thisüíúüíú

Author: MissNietzsche
Text: Yes, I reached 105 pounds (my first goal weight [took me 5 YEARS to reach]) like two months ago, and a switched flipped because I realized how unsatisfied I was at that weight and my goal dropped to 85 pounds, and I binged every day for a month and went up to 120 pounds, and then my boyfriend broke up with me last night because of my mental illnesses, so now I have no appetite :‚Äô) I feel you on the heart-broken diet. My appetite came back with a vengeance at like day 5 last time iirc though, so I‚Äôm trying to eat to avoid that. But also, since my ex left, I realized there was no point to weight loss/my ED. I did this to be perfect for him, and all it did was cause me to lose him.  I met him at 130 pounds and ballooned back up to 150, which I felt like shit at, but tbh, I think he would have stayed with me at 150 pounds if I was mentally healthy. This weight loss feels so pointless now. I don‚Äôt even know what‚Äôs gonna happen to my weight now when my appetite kicks in, but I don‚Äôt want to binge anymore. I just want to recover. I can finally say I made it to ‚Äúnot obese‚Äù once in my life, and that‚Äôs all I needed. I lost all my muscle mass and replaced it with fat, and I just give up.
